item.title: Report X-2023090376
item.description:
Report X-2023090376

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-01
  • City: BIRMINGHAM
  • State: AL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was found wet on trailer and open. A gasoline smell was emitting from the package. package was taken off the trailer and put in a hazardous bin. DescribePack: Bottles inside were bent in as if they were squeezed. DurationRel: 0 and MitigateEffect: outer box soaked up most of the leak. what little was left had evaporated.

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: RESPONDER RESPONDED TO PACKAGE WEARING PROPER PPE, DECISION TREE IN HAND. RESPONDER DISCOVERED PACKAGE LEAKING INSIDE TRAILER. USING APPROPRIATE RESPONSE SHEET, RESPONDER CONTAINED LEAKER AND TRANSPORTED TO DMP FOR FURTHER PROCESSING.

item.title: Report E-2023090656
item.description:
Report E-2023090656

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-26T18:14:26+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-19
  • City: MOBILE
  • State: AL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: MC TANK TRANSPORT INC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On September 19, 2023, at 0420 ET, Emergency Response and Training Solutions (ERTS) was contacted by MC Tank Transport Inc personnel in Mobile, Alabama regarding the release of approximately (30) gallon of Farmin DM2470 (Amines, liquid, corrosive, n.o.s. (Alkyl (C12-C14 Dimethylamine) UN2735 8, II) from a tanker. Contractors were dispatched to clean up the release. Upon arrival, contractors confirmed that the release was caused by loose flange bolts on the tanker and was contained to a 50' x 2' area of asphalt, and a 1' x 1' area of nearby soil. Contractors were able to clean up the release with absorbents, pad, and the proper PPE. They used hand tools to scrap the affected soil, and tightened the flange bolts, so the cargo could be forwarded on to the original consignee. All waste generated was containerized in (2) 55-gallon poly drums which was then taken offsite by contractors for proper disposal. No further remediation of this site is warranted.

item.title: Report X-2023090234
item.description:
Report X-2023090234

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-26T18:14:26+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-08
  • City: MONTGOMERY
  • State: AL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: RESPONDER RESPONDED TO PACKAGE WEARING PROPER PPE, DECISION TREE IN HAND. USING APPROPRIATE RESPONSE SHEET, RESPONDER TESTED THE CONTENTS, CONTAINERIZED THE ABSORBED MATERIAL INTO A LINED SPILL TRAY AND ENSURED ALL SPILLED RESIDUE WAS REMOVED FROM SPILL LOCATION. LASTLY, TRANSPORTED CONTENTS TO DMP FOR FURTHER PROCESSING.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: Damage happened in transit and was discovered when delivery was attempted. Damaged hazmat was given to BC who gave it to QA to be processed. WA628 DescribePack: 2 out of 4 glass bottles were shattered releasing their acetone DurationRel: 2 and MitigateEffect: Hazmat was placed into secure hazmat cage
